alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Ulster, northwestern Dutchess and southwestern Greene Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Port Ewen, or near Kingston, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kingston, New Paltz, Rhinebeck, Hunter, Hyde Park, Hurley, Woodstock, Highland, Red Hook, High Falls, Tillson, West Hurley, Saugerties South, Port Ewen, Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Lake Katrine, Phoenicia and Staatsburg. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 18 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Dutchess; Western Greene; Western Ulster
